001package zemeckis;
002
003import grim.annotations.OmitClinit;
004import grim.annotations.OmitSymbol;
005import grim.annotations.OmitType;
006import java.util.Objects;
007import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
008import javax.annotation.Nullable;
009import org.jetbrains.annotations.TestOnly;
010import org.jetbrains.annotations.VisibleForTesting;
011import org.realityforge.braincheck.BrainCheckConfig;
012import static org.realityforge.braincheck.Guards.*;
013
014/**
015 * This class is the main entrypoint for the Zemeckis library. It provides the access to global
016 * configuration settings as well as methods for scheduling tasks asynchronously.
017 *
018 * <p>Zemeckis has an internal clock that represents time as a monotonically increasing
019 * <code>int</code> value. The value may or may not have a direct relationship to wall-clock
020 * time and the unit of the value is defined by the implementation.</p>
021 *
022 * <p>The scheduler assigns tasks to different {@link VirtualProcessorUnit} (VPU) instances that run at
023 * different phases in the browser lifecycle. Tasks can be scheduled on the:</p>
024 * <ul>
025 * <li>"Macro" task VPU. The normal phase where event callbacks, timer timeouts, message channel handlers etc. are invoked.</li>
026 * <li>"Micro" task VPU. Invoked immediately after the current "Macro" or "Micro" task.</li>
027 * <li>"animationFrame" VPU. Invoked prior to the next browser render.</li>
028 * <li>"afterFrame" VPU. Invoked after the next browser render.</li>
029 * <li>"onIdle" VPU. Invoked when the browser is idle.</li>
030 * </ul>
031 */
032@OmitClinit
033public final class Zemeckis
034{
035  private Zemeckis()
036  {
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Return true if user should pass names into API methods, false if should pass null.
041   *
042   * @return true if user should pass names into API methods, false if should pass null.
043   */
044  public static boolean areNamesEnabled()
045  {
046    return ZemeckisConfig.areNamesEnabled();
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Return true if uncaught error handlers are enabled.
051   *
052   * @return true if uncaught error handlers are enabled, false otherwise.
053   */
054  public static boolean areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled()
055  {
056    return ZemeckisConfig.areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled();
057  }
058  /**
059   * Return true if message channels should be used to schedule tasks in the next macro
060   * task rather than setTimeout(..., 0).
061   *
062   * @return true if message channels should be used to schedule tasks over setTimeout, false otherwise.
063   */
064  public static boolean useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks()
065  {
066    return !ZemeckisConfig.isJvm() && ZemeckisConfig.useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks();
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Return true if delayed tasks should be scheduled in a worker rather than in the main thread.
071   * The worker is less likely to be throttled and suffers form less jitter.
072   *
073   * @return true if delayed tasks should be scheduled in a worker rather than in the main thread, false otherwise.
074   */
075  public static boolean useWorkerToScheduleDelayedTasks()
076  {
077    return !ZemeckisConfig.isJvm() && ZemeckisConfig.useWorkerToScheduleDelayedTasks();
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Return true if interactions with workers for scheduling delayed tasks should be logged.
082   * This is primarily useful when debugging problems with the library and is not expected to be widely used.
083   *
084   * @return true if interactions with workers for scheduling delayed tasks should be logged, false otherwise.
085   */
086  public static boolean shouldLogWorkerInteractions()
087  {
088    return useWorkerToScheduleDelayedTasks() && ZemeckisConfig.shouldLogWorkerInteractions();
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Return true if invariants will be checked.
093   *
094   * @return true if invariants will be checked.
095   */
096  public static boolean shouldCheckInvariants()
097  {
098    return BrainCheckConfig.checkInvariants();
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Return true if apiInvariants will be checked.
103   *
104   * @return true if apiInvariants will be checked.
105   */
106  public static boolean shouldCheckApiInvariants()
107  {
108    return BrainCheckConfig.checkApiInvariants();
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Return true if active tasks will be purged if the scheduler is still running after the maximum number of rounds.
113   *
114   * @return true if active tasks will be purged if the scheduler is still running after the maximum number of rounds.
115   */
116  public static boolean purgeTasksWhenRunawayDetected()
117  {
118    return ZemeckisConfig.purgeTasksWhenRunawayDetected();
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Add error handler to the list of error handlers called.
123   * The handler should not already be in the list. This method should NOT be called if
124   * {@link #areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled()} returns false.
125   *
126   * @param handler the error handler.
127   */
128  public static void addUncaughtErrorHandler( @Nonnull final UncaughtErrorHandler handler )
129  {
130    UncaughtErrorHandlerSupport.get().addUncaughtErrorHandler( handler );
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Remove error handler from list of existing error handlers.
135   * The handler should already be in the list. This method should NOT be called if
136   * {@link #areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled()} returns false.
137   *
138   * @param handler the error handler.
139   */
140  public static void removeUncaughtErrorHandler( @Nonnull final UncaughtErrorHandler handler )
141  {
142    UncaughtErrorHandlerSupport.get().removeUncaughtErrorHandler( handler );
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Report an uncaught error in stream.
147   *
148   * @param error the error.
149   */
150  public static void reportUncaughtError( @Nonnull final Throwable error )
151  {
152    if ( areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled() )
153    {
154      UncaughtErrorHandlerSupport.get().onUncaughtError( error );
155    }
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Return a value representing the "current time" of the scheduler.
160   *
161   * @return the "current time" of the scheduler.
162   */
163  public static int now()
164  {
165    return TemporalScheduler.now();
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
170   *
171   * @param task  the task to execute.
172   * @param delay the delay before the task should execute. Must be a value greater than 0.
173   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
174   */
175  @Nonnull
176  public static Cancelable delayedTask( @Nonnull final Runnable task, final int delay )
177  {
178    return delayedTask( null, task, delay );
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
183   *
184   * @param name  A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
185   * @param task  the task to execute.
186   * @param delay the delay before the task should execute. Must be a value greater than 0.
187   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
188   */
189  @Nonnull
190  public static Cancelable delayedTask( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task, final int delay )
191  {
192    final String actualName = generateName( "DelayedTask", name );
193    return TemporalScheduler.delayedTask( actualName, () -> becomeMacroTask( actualName, task ), delay );
194  }
195
196  /**
197   * Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period.
198   *
199   * @param task   the task to execute.
200   * @param period the period after execution when the task should be re-executed. Must be a value greater than 0.
201   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
202   */
203  @Nonnull
204  public static Cancelable periodicTask( @Nonnull final Runnable task, final int period )
205  {
206    return periodicTask( null, task, period );
207  }
208
209  /**
210   * Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period.
211   *
212   * @param name   A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
213   * @param task   the task to execute.
214   * @param period the period after execution when the task should be re-executed. Must be a value greater than 0.
215   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
216   */
217  @Nonnull
218  public static Cancelable periodicTask( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task, final int period )
219  {
220    final String actualName = generateName( "PeriodicTask", name );
221    return TemporalScheduler.periodicTask( actualName, () -> becomeMacroTask( actualName, task ), period );
222  }
223
224  /**
225   * Return true if there is a current VirtualProcessorUnit activated.
226   *
227   * @return true if there is a current VirtualProcessorUnit activated.
228   */
229  public static boolean isVpuActivated()
230  {
231    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.isVpuActivated();
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Return the current VirtualProcessorUnit.
236   *
237   * @return the current VirtualProcessorUnit.
238   */
239  @Nullable
240  public static VirtualProcessorUnit currentVpu()
241  {
242    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.currentVpu();
243  }
244
245  /**
246   * Queue the task to execute in the current or next "macro" task.
247   * This task is schedule via a {@code setTimeout(callback,0)} call or a send operation on a message channel
248   * depending on the value returned by {@link Zemeckis#useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks()}.
249   *
250   * @param task the task.
251   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
252   */
253  @Nonnull
254  public static Cancelable macroTask( @Nonnull final Runnable task )
255  {
256    return macroTask( null, task );
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Queue the task to execute in the current or next "macro" task.
261   * This task is schedule via a {@code setTimeout(callback,0)} call or a send operation on a message channel
262   * depending on the value returned by {@link Zemeckis#useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks()}.
263   *
264   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
265   * @param task the task.
266   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
267   */
268  @Nonnull
269  public static Cancelable macroTask( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
270  {
271    return macroTaskVpu().queue( generateName( "MacroTask", name ), task );
272  }
273
274  /**
275   * Return the "macro" task VirtualProcessorUnit.
276   *
277   * @return the "macro" task VirtualProcessorUnit.
278   * @see #macroTask(Runnable)
279   */
280  @Nonnull
281  public static VirtualProcessorUnit macroTaskVpu()
282  {
283    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.macroTaskVpu();
284  }
285
286  /**
287   * Run specified task now by queuing on the MacroTask queue and activating the MacroTask VirtualProcessorUnit.
288   * This is used internally by the toolkit when the browser has triggered a macro task as a result of a callback
289   * of some kind. The specified task is added to the start of the macroTask queue but any tasks present on the queue
290   * will be invoked after the specified task.
291   *
292   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
293   * @param task the task.
294   */
295  @VisibleForTesting
296  static void becomeMacroTask( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
297  {
298    if ( shouldCheckApiInvariants() )
299    {
300      apiInvariant( () -> !isVpuActivated(),
301                    () -> "Zemeckis-0012: Zemeckis.becomeMacroTask(...) invoked for the task named '" + name +
302                          "' but the VirtualProcessorUnit named '" + currentVpu() + "' is already active" );
303    }
304    final VirtualProcessorUnit.Executor executor = macroTaskVpu().getExecutor();
305    executor.queueNext( name, Objects.requireNonNull( task ) );
306    executor.activate();
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * Queue the task to execute in the current or next "micro" task.
311   * The "micro" tasks are those that the browser executes after the current "macro".
312   * This task is schedule via a call that looks like {@code Promise.resolve().then( v -> callback() )}.
313   *
314   * @param task the task.
315   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
316   */
317  @Nonnull
318  public static Cancelable microTask( @Nonnull final Runnable task )
319  {
320    return microTask( null, task );
321  }
322
323  /**
324   * Queue the task to execute in the current or next "micro" task.
325   * The "micro" tasks are those that the browser executes after the current "macro".
326   * The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like {@code Promise.resolve().then( v -> callback() )}.
327   *
328   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
329   * @param task the task.
330   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
331   */
332  @Nonnull
333  public static Cancelable microTask( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
334  {
335    return microTaskVpu().queue( generateName( "MicroTask", name ), task );
336  }
337
338  /**
339   * Return the "micro" task VirtualProcessorUnit.
340   *
341   * @return the "micro" task VirtualProcessorUnit.
342   * @see #microTask(Runnable)
343   */
344  @Nonnull
345  public static VirtualProcessorUnit microTaskVpu()
346  {
347    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.microTaskVpu();
348  }
349
350  /**
351   * Queue the task to execute in the current or next "animationFrame".
352   * The "animationFrame" occurs prior to the next render frame.
353   * The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like {@code requestAnimationFrame( callback )}.
354   *
355   * @param task the task.
356   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
357   */
358  @Nonnull
359  public static Cancelable animationFrame( @Nonnull final Runnable task )
360  {
361    return animationFrame( null, task );
362  }
363
364  /**
365   * Queue the task to execute in the current or next "animationFrame".
366   * The "animationFrame" occurs prior to the next render frame.
367   * The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like {@code requestAnimationFrame( callback )}.
368   *
369   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
370   * @param task the task.
371   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
372   */
373  @Nonnull
374  public static Cancelable animationFrame( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
375  {
376    return animationFrameVpu().queue( generateName( "AnimationFrameTask", name ), task );
377  }
378
379  /**
380   * Return the "animationFrame" VirtualProcessorUnit.
381   *
382   * @return the "animationFrame" VirtualProcessorUnit.
383   * @see #microTask(Runnable)
384   */
385  @Nonnull
386  public static VirtualProcessorUnit animationFrameVpu()
387  {
388    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.animationFrameVpu();
389  }
390
391  /**
392   * Queue the task to execute after the next browser render.
393   * The "afterFrame" tasks are invoked after the next frames render by responding to a message on a
394   * MessageChannel that is sent in a callback scheduled via {@code requestAnimationFrame()}.
395   *
396   * @param task the task.
397   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
398   */
399  @Nonnull
400  public static Cancelable afterFrame( @Nonnull final Runnable task )
401  {
402    return afterFrame( null, task );
403  }
404
405  /**
406   * Queue the task to execute after the next browser render.
407   * The "afterFrame" tasks are invoked after the next frames render by responding to a message on a
408   * MessageChannel that is sent in a callback scheduled via {@code requestAnimationFrame()}.
409   *
410   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
411   * @param task the task.
412   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
413   */
414  @Nonnull
415  public static Cancelable afterFrame( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
416  {
417    return afterFrameVpu().queue( generateName( "AfterFrameTask", name ), task );
418  }
419
420  /**
421   * Return the "afterFrame" VirtualProcessorUnit.
422   *
423   * @return the "afterFrame" VirtualProcessorUnit.
424   * @see #microTask(Runnable)
425   */
426  @Nonnull
427  public static VirtualProcessorUnit afterFrameVpu()
428  {
429    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.afterFrameVpu();
430  }
431
432  /**
433   * Queue the task to execute when the browser is idle.
434   * The browser activates the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit when idle and will pass the duration or
435   * deadline until which the VirtualProcessorUnit may run. The VirtualProcessorUnit will execute tasks
436   * scheduled via onIdle as long as there are tasks queued and the deadline has not been reached after
437   * which the VirtualProcessorUnit will return control to the browser. Unlike other scheduling strategies,
438   * when the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit completes the activation, there may still be tasks in the queue
439   * and if there is the VirtualProcessorUnit will re-schedule itself for another activation.
440   * The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like {@code requestIdleCallback( callback )}.
441   *
442   * @param task the task.
443   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
444   */
445  @Nonnull
446  public static Cancelable onIdle( @Nonnull final Runnable task )
447  {
448    return onIdle( null, task );
449  }
450
451  /**
452   * Queue the task to execute when the browser is idle.
453   * The browser activates the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit when idle and will pass the duration or
454   * deadline until which the VirtualProcessorUnit may run. The VirtualProcessorUnit will execute tasks
455   * scheduled via onIdle as long as there are tasks queued and the deadline has not been reached after
456   * which the VirtualProcessorUnit will return control to the browser. Unlike other scheduling strategies,
457   * when the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit completes the activation, there may still be tasks in the queue
458   * and if there is the VirtualProcessorUnit will re-schedule itself for another activation.
459   * The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like {@code requestIdleCallback( callback )}.
460   *
461   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
462   * @param task the task.
463   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
464   */
465  @Nonnull
466  public static Cancelable onIdle( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
467  {
468    return onIdleVpu().queue( generateName( "OnIdleTask", name ), task );
469  }
470
471  /**
472   * Return the "onIdle" VirtualProcessorUnit.
473   *
474   * @return the "onIdle" VirtualProcessorUnit.
475   * @see #microTask(Runnable)
476   */
477  @Nonnull
478  public static VirtualProcessorUnit onIdleVpu()
479  {
480    return VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.onIdleVpu();
481  }
482
483  /**
484   * Build name for task.
485   * If {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns false then this method will return null, otherwise the specified
486   * name will be returned or a name synthesized from the prefix and a running number if no name is specified.
487   *
488   * @param prefix the prefix used if this method needs to generate name.
489   * @param name   the name specified by the user.
490   * @return the name.
491   */
492  @OmitSymbol( unless = "zemeckis.enable_names" )
493  @Nullable
494  static String generateName( @Nonnull final String prefix, @Nullable final String name )
495  {
496    return Zemeckis.areNamesEnabled() ?
497           null != name ? name : prefix + "@" + IdContainer.c_nextTaskId++ :
498           null;
499  }
500
501  @TestOnly
502  static void reset()
503  {
504    IdContainer.c_nextTaskId = 0;
505  }
506
507  @OmitType( unless = "zemeckis.enable_names" )
508  private static final class IdContainer
509  {
510    /**
511     * Id of next node to be created.
512     * This is only used if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true but no name has been supplied.
513     */
514    @OmitSymbol( unless = "zemeckis.enable_names" )
515    private static int c_nextTaskId = 1;
516
517  }
518}
